attributes.comment:
As an Adoptive Parent, I strongly oppose the proposed fee increase for the
processing of the I-600A and fingerprints because it will substantially increase the
cost of international adoptions, particularly since the approvals are invalid after 18
months from issuance. Now that the adoptions are taking well over 18 months
from I-600A approval to completion, any further increase will be a further deterrent
to people wanting to adopt, which would be a travesty. There are already so many
people in this country who would adopt if it weren't for financial barriers, and this
rule would worsen the problem. With the increasing number of deaths caused by
poverty, AIDS, and other tragic causes, the number of orphans throughout the
world is increasing exponentially every day. I'd like to think that the U.S. would be
doing something to help bring these orphans into loving families, rather than
discouraging adoption by increasing fees that already are very high, especially
given the fact that most parents adopting internationally are forced to pay the fees
twice. At the very least, if the fees are increased, the rule should also extend the
validity of the approval from 18 months to 2 years or more, to apply retroactively to
adoptive parents already in the process. Thank you for allowing me a chance to
oppose this proposed rule, which likely will have tragic consequences if it is
enacted.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Philip Darke
